item.title: Questions For Megan Woods
item.description: Government defends import-only strategy The Ministry of Business, Innovation and Employment (MBIE) said that “would mark a significant change in New Zealand’s fuel supply chain”. But its advice was that the supply chain was secure because the country could get fuel from multiple locations overseas. It was “very unlikely” the country would ever be cut off entirely, and if it were, this would cut shipping of crude oil, too, the ministry told RNZ.
